content.description: The first sip of Sauvignon Choss is powerful from the first moves.  Make big moves on big holds for 20 feet up and out the bulge.  Pause here, take a breath, swirl your glass.  From here notes of cherry, plum and apple blossom highlight the thinner moves up the face, passing a distinct crux reach before settling down into a 10+ bright finish climbing to the anchor.  Fun climbing and destined for obscurity!
content.protection: 10 or so bolts. eye protection for the belayer getting the choss shower.
content.location: Center of the Wine Wall.  Left of the Route Whisperer, right of Grape Juice.

content.description: Start off of the rock directly right of the large wet scoop. 1st bolt should be able to be clipped from the ground. Up the slab to an old Star Driven bolt (bomber) then over a small caped bulge. From here keep the crack on your right and power up through the overhang to a huge ledge. Easy finish to the anchors.
content.location: Far right of the Wine Wall and the left border of the Iron Curtain area.  Spy vs Spy will be just right of you as you climb.

content.description: Up the steep arete then break left at the ledge and then up the steep awesome face above. Great for hot days since it stays in the shade most of the day!
content.location: This is the route that breaks off of the arete to the left and tackles the steep ramp / face.

content.description: The obvious left arete feature on the fin is tackled on large holds and awesome exposure! Long!

P1- (14 bolts) Start just left of a small alcove. Pull up the large features then follow jugs through overlaps on a line that trends slightly left. Rest up at a ledge before tackling the steeper wall with progressively smaller features before the belay ledge is reached.

P2- (9 bolts) Angle slightly right from the belay and tackle the immediate headwall. This is followed by a low angle ramp then finishes with another 4 bolt steeper headwall guarding the top of the cliff and the final anchor.
content.location: Just left of the sharp arete of Grape Vine/ Grape Juice.
